name: UN Global Data Quality System
description: Data quality level and criteria of the UN Environment Global Guidance on LCA database development. Table E.1 in EN 15804:2012 + A2:2019.

scores.label: Poor
scores.description: Data on related processes or products; organic wheat under study, data for organic rye provided.

scores.label: Good
scores.description: Data from processes and products under study (with similar technology). Evidence of deviations in state of technology, e.g. different by-product.

scores.label: Very poor
scores.description: Data on related processes on but with a different scale or from different technology; organic wheat under study, data for conventional wheat provided.

scores.label: Very good
scores.description: Data from processes and products under study. Same state of technology applied as defined in goal and scope (i.e. identical technology).

scores.label: Fair
scores.description: Data from processes and products under study but from different technology. This score is also applied when no technology is specified; e.g. wheat (no further specification).

scores.label: Fair
scores.description: Data from area with similar production conditions.

scores.label: Very poor
scores.description: Data from unknown or distinctly different area (North America instead of Middle East, OECD- Europe instead of Russia).

scores.label: Poor
scores.description: Data from area with slightly similar production conditions.

scores.label: Good
scores.description: Average data from larger area in which the area under study is included.

scores.label: Very poor
scores.description: Age of data unknown or more than 15 years of difference between the reference year according to the documentation, and the time period for which data are representative.

scores.label: Good
scores.description: Less than 6 years of difference between the reference year according to the documentation, and the time period for which data are representative.

scores.label: Very good
scores.description: Less than 3 years difference between the reference year according to the documentation, and the time period for which data are representative.

scores.label: Fair
scores.description: Less than 10 years of difference between the reference year according to the documentation, and the time period for which data are representative.

scores.label: Poor
scores.description: Less than 15 years of difference between the reference year according to the documentation, and the time period for which data are representative
